bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF JOHN LEONARD FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS. NOTICE OF APPEAL.

To the State of Washington and R.A. Simms, Esq., Sheriff of Whitman County, State of Washington and to Honorable John w. Mathews, Prosecuting Attorney and County Attorney for Whitman County, Washington, and H.W. Canfield of Counsel.

Now comes the Petitioner John Leonard and appeals the above entitled cause and the whole thereof to the Supreme Court of the United States, holding terms at the City of Washington, district of Columbia, and to the next regular term thereof, and more especially appeals from that certain order made and entered in the above entitled cause on the 22nd day of June, 1897, by Honorable C.H. Hanford, sitting as Circuit Judge denying the Petition of Petitioner for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and refusing to grant the said Writ of Habeas Corpus as in his said petition prayed.

And you will please take notice that the record and proceedings upon the said Petition willbe duly served through the said above entitled court to the Supreme Court of the United States at the next regular term thereof upon said above named appeal. John P. Dor J.E. Peyton Del Cary Smith Attorneys for Petitioner
